blog.description: I'm a fan of Jon, the North, and the Starks.  Not a Jonsa, but an ally because they are nice, rational people unlike other parts of GOT fandom that will remain nameless.  (Apparently I'm also a sexist crazy person for having bad, ungood opinions about Daenerys Targaryen!  And I also set up alts and post anonymous comments and talk to myself on AO3...  Sarc off.  Yeah, fandom is pissing me off right now.)

tags: Writers hate Jon and the Starks
They derided Jon for killing his mom in the scripts
and make him stupid as shit
Dany fans reveal themselves to be sexist again
I just prefer the Starks to Dany
Using sexist slurs to remind everyone gow woke we are
summary: Why are you such a dumb cunt man... D&D literally did a panel in Brazil and said Benioff said his favorite house is the Starks....
question: Why are you such a dumb cunt man... D&D literally did a panel in Brazil and said Benioff said his favorite house is the Starks. Keep crying
answer:
More hate mail.  I especially love accusing people of misogyny while using such an ugly sexist slur against a woman.  Didn’t your mother teach you the proper way to address ladies? Tsk Tsk.

And the scripts make it very clear that D&D hate both the Starks and Jon.  They actually called Jon the thing that killed Lyanna.  I don’t see alot of like there.

tags: Why are the showrunners so biased against Jon?
Gosh are the GOT scripts incredibly anti-Stark
summary: Vanity Fair Game of Throne Scripts
title: Vanity Fair Game of Throne Scripts
body:
I haven’t had time to read the “scripts” and think that people are trying to deduce things based on Easter Eggs that don’t mean that much.  However, it does seem like the entire tone of the scripts, especially D&D juvenile asides, are anti-Stark and incredibly anti-Jon.  Does anyone have any insight into why the writers of the show hate the Starks and hate Jon as a character?  Is it just them tearing down the male characters to make Daenerys Targaryen look good?  Or is it something else?

I was aware how much the writers disliked Jon as a character based on how stupid they made in Season 6 and Season 7.  But even I was stunned by the amount of vitriol the writers direct toward the main heroes of the story in their scripts.  The writers’ weird, vitriolic biases against the Starks may end up really ruining the show even more than the fact that Martin will never finish the last two books.

I was aware how much the writers disliked Jon as a character based on how stupid they made in Season 6 and Season 7.  But even I was stunned by the amount of vitriol the writers direct toward the main heroes of the story in their scripts.  The writers’ weird, vitriolic biases against the Starks may end up really ruining the show even more than the fact that Martin will never finish the last two books.
trail.content:
I haven’t had time to read the “scripts” and think that people are trying to deduce things based on Easter Eggs that don’t mean that much.  However, it does seem like the entire tone of the scripts, especially D&D juvenile asides, are anti-Stark and incredibly anti-Jon.  Does anyone have any insight into why the writers of the show hate the Starks and hate Jon as a character?  Is it just them tearing down the male characters to make Daenerys Targaryen look good?  Or is it something else?

I was aware how much the writers disliked Jon as a character based on how stupid they made in Season 6 and Season 7.  But even I was stunned by the amount of vitriol the writers direct toward the main heroes of the story in their scripts.  The writers’ weird, vitriolic biases against the Starks may end up really ruining the show even more than the fact that Martin will never finish the last two books.

blog.title: It is better to be ridiculous than boring

summary: Gendry's Parentage: would that be an issue next season?
body:
Gendry’s Parentage: would that be an issue next season?

Robert’s Bastards played a huge role in season 1 and were one of the critical factors that led to the war of the five kings. But then later, Joffrey had them all murdered except Gendry. That poor boy had been chased, chained and even was about to be burnt before Davos let him escape from dragons tone. After all that rowing, he is now finally back in the game.

His return is inevitable and highly beneficial. The Northern army needs a competent blacksmith. He is also a great marathon champion 😉. In addition to this, he is the only guy who could be the love interest of Arya at the end of the series.

But he could be the guy who could fit into all of the above, without having Robert as his father. However, similar to Jon snow, Gendry’s parentage was also given specific importance in the story. It remains to be seen if it would continue to matter next season.

Anyway, personally I feel like his birth would lead to yet another conflict in Westeros. When Davos brought Gendry back to Dragonstone, he knew he was taking a huge risk i.e harboring the heir of a fallen dynasty in secret( somehow similar to what Ned did after Robert’s rebellion). As a matter of fact, Davos didn’t even want Jon to know about Gendry, however their relationship turned out to be cordial.

But what about Dany, she still doesn’t know who Gendry really is, the son of teh usurper she had hated all her life. I know that Dany is not the person to judge an individual by their parent’s crimes blah blah blah. But Gendry isn’t just a Lord’s bastard, he is the bastard of King Robert, the first of his name. He is definitely a threat to her, as long as he lives.

He may be a bastard, but it didn’t stop Jon from ascending the Northern throne. It is a common knowledge that no one wants another Targaryen in the IT, just like how Boltons were hated in the North.

What makes this matter even worse is that she has not been informed about Gendry yet, not by Jon not by Davos. Even Tyrion doesn’t know that yet.

Imagine you are in Dany’s position, it would be bad enough when she comes to learn that Jon is her nephew, then she also have to digest the fact he has been keeping the heir of house baratheon right under her nose.

Wouldn’t that feel like a betrayal?

summary: My friend doesn't watch Game of Thrones and I asked her to describe the characters:
body:
My friend doesn’t watch Game of Thrones and I asked her to describe the characters:

Arya: Baby girl, baby

Sansa: She has nice hair and relationship issues

Jon: Apparently, he knows nothing

Bran: Tiny

Rickon: The zig-zag man

Robb: Dead?

Theon: Robin Hood

Daenerys: The one that’s nice to look at

Viserys: Legolas

Khal Drogo: He looks like Aquaman

Jorah: He looks like a very tired dad

Cersei: That’s the bitch, right?

Jaime: Handicapped twin of the bitch

Tyrion: Oh, that’s Peter Dinklage

Joffrey: Dickhead

The Hound: Two-face but with Thor’s hair

Margaery: She’s ginger and pretty, I like her

Melisandre: Pretty scary witch lady

Stannis: He’s got that flaming sword, right?

Shireen: Tiny baby girl with velociraptor skin

Ygritte: Angry Merida that knows more than Jon Snow

Ramsay: The dude that’s pretty and scary

Night King: Elsa with freezer burn

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: So I'm Re-Watching Game of Thrones and....
body:
So I’m Re-Watching Game of Thrones and….

I’m on episode 2. Jamie Lannister just approached Jon Snow and asked if he has ever swung his sword…at someone.

Jamie then proceeds to intimidate and kind of belittle Snow.

I can’t help but wonder if this is a foreshadow for season 8…maybe we’ll get Jon Snow swinging his sword at Jamie Lannister.

Idk, I’m just very excited for GOT Season 8.

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

summary:
Dany: And I have fewer enemies today than I did
yesterday. You're not sure how you feel about that.

 Jon: No, I'm not. Dany:...
body:
Dany: And I have fewer enemies today than I did yesterday. You’re not sure how you feel about that.

Jon: No, I’m not.

Dany: How many men did your army kill taking Winterfell back from the Boltons?

Jon: Thousands.

Dany: We both want to help people.We can only help them from a position of strength. Sometimes strength is terrible.

“As much as Jon would like to argue, it would be hypocrisy for him to do so” - season 7 script for Eastwatch

I love Jon Snow and I am glad that I stan for an amazing character. He is wise and smart and good. He does not like killing and battles, but he recognizes that what Dany is doing is only what he and Sansa did. And that if Jon and Sansa can fight for their birthright, then so can Dany - especially if they all want to do it for what they think is the greater good. Westeros is a feudal society . There is no one noble family or house who is better or greater than any other house. Only the smallfolk are totally selfless and innocent in all this.

Jon is wise enough to understand what Dany is saying here. Meanwhile in WF, Sansa kicks out her sworn sword Brienne, because she does not want to share her with Arya!  But Sansa is so much more smarter than Jon you guys!!!!!

Next time Sansa/Jonsa stans open their mouths to shit on Dany, we should just use Jon Snow from the scripts and show to answer their nonsense. Jon would be baffled by the absolute hypocrisy coming from that side of the fandom.
